document.docAuthor: Dow, Rory A., Hämäläinen, Matti & Stokvis, Frank R.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the genus Devadatta Kirby, 1890 in Borneo based on molecular and morphological methods, with descriptions of four new species (Odonata: Zygoptera: Devadattidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the genus Devadatta Kirby, 1890 in Borneo based on molecular and morphological methods, with descriptions of four new species (Odonata: Zygoptera: Devadattidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. Holotype :
1 ♂
(JvT 2082 ), Maloong, northeastern Basilan Island, the Philippines , collector unknown,
1 xii 1932
, in RMNH .

Other material examined.
1
♂, Labauan Mountains, Manucan 20 km S, Zamboanga de Norte, South Mindanao, the Philippines , 380m ,
15 x 1959
, leg. Quate, in RMNH ; 1 ♀, Cotabato, Mindanao, the Philippines ,
13 i 1954
, leg. H. Townes, in RMNH ; 1 ♀, Mt Makatoring, Alamada, North Cotabato, Mindanao, the Philippines , 700- 900m ,
1–8 ii 1992
, leg. T. Borromeo, ex. coll. Müller, in RMNH ;
2 ♂
( RMNH .INS. 506620, 506623 ), Dispatcheng, Purok 5 , Aliwagwag, Davao Oriental, Mindanao, the Philippines ,
11 vi 2012
, leg. H. Cahilog, in RMNH ;
1 ♂
( MIN 12 _ AMP 9 ), same data, in coll. Dow;
1 ♂
( RMNH .INS. 506608 ), same location and date, leg. R.A. Dow, in RMNH ;
1 ♂
, same data, in coll. Dow;
3 ♂
1 ♀, same location,
12 vi 2012
, leg. H. Cahilog, in coll. Dow;
1 ♂
( RMNH .INS. 506630 ), same location and date, leg. R.A. Dow, in RMNH ;
3 ♂
, same data, in coll. Dow.
Measurements [mm]: Abdomen without anal appendages 34.5, cerci ca 1 , Hw 32.5.
Abdomen: Cerci black, subtriangular, ca same length as S 10 . Ovipositor short, only reaching beyond S 10 to ca level of tips of cerci.
Measurements [mm]: Abdomen without ovipositor and appendages 35.5, Hw 35 .

Remarks. The habitus of a typical male from Mindanao is shown in
Fig. 9
, and the wings of both sexes are illustrated in
Figs. 34–35
. The illustrations of the male anal appendages in
Needham & Gyger ( 1939 : plate 13 )
of the apparently synonymous
D. filipina
Needham & Gyger, 1939
, have been transposed with those of Vest al is melania Selys, 1873 , Figs. 168 and 169 are stated to be
D. filipina
but are actually V. melania whilst Figs. 166 and 167 show
D. filipina
.

There is one crossvein in the cubito-anal space of the right Hw of the holotype , despite the statement “Cubitoanal space uncrossed” in the key in Laidlaw ( 1934 ). The holotype differs further from the male described above by having reduced pale markings on the head, in particular no brown band between the postocular lobes; there are also small differences in the lateral markings of the synthorax.
